Daemos gets the autopilot locked and goes in the back of the ship with 
everyone else.

Daemos: Gather up! Time for tactical plan. The area we're going to 
occupy is on the south-east side of the Etna Volcano. It's about 6 
klicks from the mouth of the volcano. It's a rocky place, and a little 
slopy as well. Be careful though. Geological reports state it is still 
active, and lava holes could be still soft. Anachronox and Jetstorm, 
you will act as the vanguard. I'm counting on both of you to secure 
the hotspot if we are not welcome. The Prophets will drop 1 minute 
after you. They'll relieve you if we are attacked. Understood? As for 
me, I'll land the ship one klickk farther and join the fray with the 
seeds. Questions?

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> The same warmth engulfs Belthassan. One moment he was passing out, 
the 
> next, he was fully able bodied. He stood up slowly.
> 
> Belthassan: Thank you, friend. This was truly... energizing!
> 
> Now, Gesper, we are going on potentially enemy territory. This is 
> operation GardenParty. We are supposed to plant fruits and keep the 
> enclave until we can harvest.
> 
> Gesper nods and unstraps the device. Belthassan does so too.
> 
> Belthassan: Daemos, everyone is okay. Please proceed.
> 
> Daemos: I read you.
> 
> The ship accelerates towards greece.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> > -- Anachronox --
> > 
> > Anachronox straps on the box that Melchana tosses him and presses 
> > his hand to it. "What is supposed to happen Melchana?"
> > 
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > Melchana: Follow me!
> > > 
> > > She grabs Gesper and drags him the nearest she can to the 
piloting 
> > > room. She leaves him on the floor, goes into the room, and 
brings 
> > back 
> > > some sort of techno-organic "metal" box. She throws one at 
> > Anachronox.
> > > 
> > > Melchana: Strap it around his chest and press your hand on it.
> > > 
> > > She straps it on Gesper, presses her hand and backs off one 
foot. 
> > The 
> > > cold form of her brother, still in semi-stasis lock, is then 
> > filled by 
> > > some kind of warm energy. It is enough to break the lock and 
bring 
> > him 
> > > to consciousness. He was not as strong as he usually was, but he 
> > was 
> > > back.
> > > 
> > > Gesper: Where am I? What happened?
> > > 
> > > Jetstorm: Hehe! Nothing a good bath can't shake away!
> > > 
> > > Belthassan, on the other hand, was cold too. He was not as bad 
as 
> > his 
> > > brother was but still...
